title: AC Milan vs Tottenham LIVE score : Champions League updates from last 16 first leg after Brahim Diaz goal
body_text:
AC Milan vs Tottenham LIVE: Champions League result and final score as Spurs survive late missed chances
AC Milan took a step towards their first Champions League quarter-final appearance for 11 years as Brahim Diaz‚Äôs goal gave the Italians a 1-0 win over Tottenham Hotspur in their last-16 first leg at the San Siro.
The Spaniard headed in a rebound in the seventh minute after a superb double save by Tottenham‚Äôs second-choice keeper Fraser Forster and the seven-time winners kept the Londoners at bay.
Spurs, weakened by injuries and suspensions, responded positively in the first half to dominate possession but were unable to seriously worry the hosts. Milan should then have increased their advantage after the break with substitutes Charles De Ketelaere and Malick Thiaw both wasting glorious headed chances.
Tottenham sent on Brazil forward Richarlison for the last 20 minutes and, while they were unable to avoid a first-ever defeat by Milan, they will head home still hopeful of turning the tie around and reaching the last eight.
Relive all the action from Milan 1-0 Tottenham, below.
Milan vs Tottenham LIVE: Latest Champions League updates
FULL TIME! Milan 1-0 Tottenham
79‚Äô CHANCE! Let off for Spurs as Thiaw misses free header (MIL 1-0 TOT)
62‚Äô YELLOW! Dier suspended for second leg after booking (MIL 1-0 TOT)
7‚Äô GOAL! Diaz heads in from close range after Hernandez beats Romero (MIL 1-0 TOT)
AC Milan 1 - 0 Tottenham Hotspur FC
FULL TIME! Milan 1-0 Tottenham
22:11 , Jamie Braidwood
‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre at home in the Champions league, if the Spurs fans get behind them they‚Äôll have a good chance,‚Äù says Rio Ferdinand. ‚ÄúHome advantage is massive in the Champions League and you would like to think Harry Kane gets more chances.‚Äù
Jermaine Jenas points out that Spurs will at least know what their task is, which he says should see Conte‚Äôs side come out of the traps in the return leg. Peter Crouch adds that Tottenham settled for 1-0 late on, as they knew it wasn‚Äôt a bad result.
FULL TIME! PSG 0-1 Bayern
22:04 , Jamie Braidwood
Kingsley Coman‚Äôs goal is enough for Bayern, who end PSG‚Äôs unbeaten home run with a 1-0 win at the Parc des Princes.
Kylian Mbappe came off the bench and saw a goal disallowed, but it‚Äôs PSG who have work to do ahead of the second leg.
PSG needed it but it wasn't meant to be ‚ùå
VAR rules out Mbappe's goal due to offside in the build-up ‚öΩÔ∏è#UCL pic.twitter.com/unF4jWKxFr‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 14, 2023
FULL TIME! Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:59 , Jamie Braidwood
Well, it could have been worse for Tottenham. Brahim Diaz‚Äôs early goal is the difference at the San Siro and Milan will take a 1-0 lead to London for the second leg.
The Italian side had two big chances late on but De Ketelaere and Thiaw missed free headers, and it means Spurs are still in this last-16 tie.
Milan weren‚Äôt great, so Spurs will be hopeful they can turn it around at home.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:59 , Jamie Braidwood
90+6 mins: Last chance for Spurs... but Emerson‚Äôs pass to Kane rolls out for a goal kick. That sums their display up.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:57 , Jamie Braidwood
90+4 mins: Opening for Kane! It breaks to the striker on the left edge of the box, but he can‚Äôt beat Kjaer, who has been touch-tight to the Spurs captain all match.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:56 , Jamie Braidwood
90+3 mins: Richarlison works a yard of space on the edge of the box, but he doesn‚Äôt take the shot on. Sarr‚Äôs cross towards Kane is then cleared.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:56 , Jamie Braidwood
90 +1 mins: Hernandez gets a yellow card after shoving Richarlison to the ground. Another free kick for Spurs, and this time Perisic‚Äôs poor cross is hacked away.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:54 , Jamie Braidwood
90 mins: Six minutes for Spurs to get a goal, or for Milan to take a big advantage into the second leg.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:53 , Jamie Braidwood
89 mins: Spurs are barely tapping on the door but a 1-0 defeat will not be the end of the world ahead of the second leg. Milan are not great, and they‚Äôll be hopeful of beating the Italian side at home.
That said, Tottenham have been so poor tonight.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:50 , Jamie Braidwood
87 mins: Davies now overhits a cross from the left wing. Not a great couple of minutes for the Wales defender.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:49 , Jamie Braidwood
85 mins: Davies thrashes a shot high and wide, but Spurs starting to keep the pressure on.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:46 , Jamie Braidwood
82 mins: Chance for Spurs! It‚Äôs their best opportunity of the second half. Perisic‚Äôs corner from the left is met by Dier eight yards out, but the England international heads it into the ground and fails to trouble the goalkeeper. Should have done better.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:45 , Jamie Braidwood
80 mins: That‚Äôs really changed the mood for Spurs now - as it feels they are hanging on all of a sudden. Sarr drags a shot wide from distance, and there‚Äôs a double change now from Conte.
Danjuma is on for Son - Davies replaces Lenglet.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:43 , Jamie Braidwood
ANOTHER CHANCE!
79 mins: Another big let off for Spurs! Milan threaten with another cross - and this time Thiaw has space for the header. He beats Skipp to the ball but can‚Äôt steer it inside the post!
Another let off!
Tottenham are hanging on here as Milan build the pressure.#UCL pic.twitter.com/ACVRBGzP5b‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 14, 2023
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:42 , Jamie Braidwood
CHANCE!
77 mins: And almost an instant impact! Leao swings it in from the left and his cross finds Giroud - it‚Äôs flicked on by the Frenchman but De Ketelaere, who was onside, can‚Äôt beat Forster from six yards!
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:40 , Jamie Braidwood
75 mins: Milan make two changes: goalscorer Diaz and Saelemaekers are off. Charles De Ketelaere and Junior Messias are on.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:38 , Jamie Braidwood
73 mins: Milan give the ball away cheaply from defence, and Spurs work it wide to Skipp. The midfielder keeps the ball in play and it‚Äôs played back to Richarlison, whose effort is blocked.
Sarr then tries an ambitious effort from 35 yards. It‚Äôs straight at the Milan goalkeeper.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:35 , Jamie Braidwood
71 mins: Kane works a yard of space after turning Kjaer, but his switch out to Emerson is easily cut out.
The lack of link-up between Kane and Son is very strange, considering how good their partnership was last season.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:32 , Jamie Braidwood
70 mins: Richarlison is coming on for Spurs - finally a change.
Richarlison replaces Kulusevski.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:31 , Jamie Braidwood
67 mins: Leao found some space on the counter-attack but Tottenham are able to slow him down. Perisic then concedes a corner at the back post, but nothing comes of it. We‚Äôre 20 minutes into the second half and there‚Äôs yet to be a chance for either team.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:29 , Jamie Braidwood
66 mins: Lenglet, of all people, finds himself in space and gets to the byline. The defender got past Krunic and Giroud but his pull-back is blocked out for a corner, and Son‚Äôs cross doesn‚Äôt lead to a chance. Tottenham‚Äôs set-pieces have been so poor.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:28 , Jamie Braidwood
65 mins: Any sign of Spurs substitutions? Not yet. Conte has Richarlison and Danjuma on the bench but there‚Äôs been no movement so far.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:26 , Jamie Braidwood
62 mins: Dier pulls Giroud‚Äôs arm after the striker turned. The defender is shown a yellow card and will now miss the second leg. Quite a harsh one considering the amount of fouls in this game - and I think that was Dier‚Äôs first.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:25 , Jamie Braidwood
62 mins: Son pops up on the right and sees his cross blocked and put behind. Perisic‚Äôs corner is easily gathered by Tatarusanu, even though the goalkeeper continues to limp on his ankle.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:23 , Jamie Braidwood
60 mins: Tatarusanu stayed down after collecting the cross, and is struggling. He can‚Äôt even take the goal kick.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:21 , Jamie Braidwood
57 mins: Kane draws a foul from Krunic and it gives Tottenham a free kick in a good position 25 yards from goal...
Son went for the cross - met by Kalulu. Kulusevski‚Äôs shot is then blocked by Kjaer and Tatarusanu gathers.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:19 , Jamie Braidwood
A goal! Here‚Äôs Kingsley Coman striking against PSG again in the Champions League. Bayern lead at the Parc des Princes - huge error from Donnarumma!
First blood Bayern Munich üî¥
Kingsley Coman finds the back of the net ‚öΩÔ∏è
The goalkeeping gets worse with every watch üò¨#UCL pic.twitter.com/jwPt7br02g‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 14, 2023
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:18 , Jamie Braidwood
54 mins: Leao‚Äôs threat is growing, as if the forward has been given a boost by Romero‚Äôs precarious position.
Tottenham then tried to break through Kane, who rolled his defender. But he couldn‚Äôt find the pass through to Son.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:16 , Jamie Braidwood
52 mins: Milan have started much better than Spurs in the second half. They play through Conte‚Äôs side and work it to Diaz, whose shot is blocked by Lenglet. Leao goes on a tricky run from left to right but Spurs clear.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:14 , Jamie Braidwood
49 mins: That was a really nasty challenge from Romero - but Tonali is back up after receiving treatment. The free kick from the left side is wasted.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:11 , Jamie Braidwood
47 mins: Chaos in the Spurs defence. Lenglet gives away a cheap pass into midfield. Milan break forward and Romero chops down Tonali on the slide. As clear a yellow card as you‚Äôll see.
Romero has had a nightmare so far and is now on thin ice, up against Leao and Hernandez on that flank.
KICK OFF! Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:08 , Jamie Braidwood
Back underway at the San Siro. Work to do for Spurs, but remember that the away goals rule is no longer used in the Champions League, so a 1-0 scoreline isn‚Äôt as disastrous as it used to be.
HALF TIME: Milan 1-0 Tottenham
21:07 , Jamie Braidwood
Sarr has done well for Spurs so far. At just 20, this is his first start in the competition.
HALF TIME: Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:56 , Jamie Braidwood
It‚Äôs goalless in Paris and it doesn‚Äôt sound like a classic.
Mbappe started on the bench after returning from injury, with Messi and Neymar yet to see a shot on target against Bayern.
HALF TIME: Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:52 , Jamie Braidwood
Spurs got off to a terrible start, but at least it hasn‚Äôt got any worse. It hasn‚Äôt been a great half and although they‚Äôve probably been the better team, Conte‚Äôs side are yet to create a clear chance. Milan‚Äôs goal was very scrappy and that will add to Tottenham‚Äôs frustration.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:51 , Jamie Braidwood
45+3 mins: There have been so many fouls in this half - the majority of which has been scrappy and low on any quality. Kjaer again brings down Kane with his back to goal. Son gets another free kick. Milan play another high line. This time, Tatarusanu punches away.
And that‚Äôs half-time!
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:50 , Jamie Braidwood
45+2 mins: There‚Äôs another scramble in the Milan box, only for the offside flag to go up. Perisic switched to Emerson, who nodded back to Kane. He went for the overhead kick but didn‚Äôt get a connection, and Emerson was then offside.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:48 , Jamie Braidwood
45 mins: OFF THE BAR! Or was it offside? It probably was offside.
Anyway, Son is played through and works a yard of space to shoot across Tatarusanu. The goalkeeper makes the save only for it breaks to Kane, but the England captain strikes the underside of the bar!
Son was offside, so it wouldn‚Äôt have counted anyway.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:45 , Jamie Braidwood
42 mins: Good defending! Emerson does really well to beat by Hernandez and Tonali down the right. He crosses towards Son but Saelemaekers read the play well and got across to clear. Perisic‚Äôs corner is wasted and gathered by Tatarusanu.
Milan look to counter but Leao blasts high and wide when looking for the top corner.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:43 , Jamie Braidwood
40 mins: Tatarusanu gets into a pickle after slicing a clearance - after Forster looked for Kulusevski with a long pass. The Milan goalkeeper gets no distance into the clearance and Hernandez has to foul Skipp.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:41 , Jamie Braidwood
38 mins: Danger for Spurs! Hernandez again beats Romero down the Milan left, this time skipping past the Spurs defender. He gets to the byline but his cross is cut out just in time.
Poor from Romero, though. Again.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:40 , Jamie Braidwood
36 mins: Kane draws another foul off Kjaer, who has been right in the Tottenham striker‚Äôs back whenever he‚Äôs been played the ball. Skipp then does well to cut out a pass from Giroud to Leao.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:37 , Jamie Braidwood
35 mins: It hasn‚Äôt been a great game, though, and you can tell both of these teams are below their best. Sarr and Skipp have done well enough in midfield.
Meanwhile, Glenn Hoddle is pitching the idea of playing Perisic in centre midfield. That‚Äôs a new one.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:35 , Jamie Braidwood
31 mins: Kane is back up after receiving treatment. Tottenham have been better in terms of general play since going behind, but they haven‚Äôt troubled Tatarusanu yet. Conceding that goal must be so frustrating too as Milan haven‚Äôt done much to deserve to be ahead.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:32 , Jamie Braidwood
29 mins: Perisic skips around the outside of Saelemaekers but Hernandez beats Kane to the header. The Tottenham captain stays down, after he was caught by Kjaer.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:30 , Jamie Braidwood
27 mins: Milan‚Äôs defenders are looking to get as tight as possible to Tottenham‚Äôs front three. Thiaw crashes into Kulusevski from behind to concede a foul, while Kjaer is also looking to do the same whenever Kane gets it.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:28 , Jamie Braidwood
24 mins: Son looks to whip it this time - and that could have gone anywhere! A Milan player deflects it out for a corner, which Milan are then able to clear.
Tottenham are applying pressure though and have responded well to going behind. Emerson tries his luck from range but fires it straight at Tatarusanu.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:25 , Jamie Braidwood
22 mins: Kane does well to receive the ball and turn, before trying to slip in Kulusevski‚Äôs diagonal run. Kalulu steps across well to clear.
Lenglet is then fouled by Saelemaekers out wide - another free kick for Spurs.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:22 , Jamie Braidwood
20 mins: Lenglet carries forward and plays wide to Perisic, who is fouled. It gives Son another chance to test that deep Milan line, but Dier heads wide.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:21 , Jamie Braidwood
17 mins: Here‚Äôs the goal. Romero simply has to do better to stop Hernandez - this time France beats Argentina.
The San Siro erupts üî¥‚ö´Ô∏è
Brahim Diaz scores for Serie A holders Milan...#UCL pic.twitter.com/bm8FVnVAOd‚Äî Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) February 14, 2023
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:19 , Jamie Braidwood
16 mins: Spurs wanted to take a free kick early but it was too quick for the referee, who pulls it back after Son found Kulusevski. Milan are playing such a deep line from free kicks.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:17 , Jamie Braidwood
14 mins: The whistles tell you that Tottenham are starting to knock some passes together. Son and Kulusevski drift over to the right but Milan are able to clear. Kane loses the ball with Kjaer coming in from behind, before he then draws a foul from the Milan defender.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:15 , Jamie Braidwood
12 mins: Chance! Son swings in a free kick from deep and Dier is able to flick it on. Tatarusanu is able to gather but if it was easier side the Milan goalkeeper may have been beaten.
Milan 1-0 Tottenham
20:14 , Jamie Braidwood
9 mins: Hernandez‚Äôs shot took a slight deflection off Dier before it reached Forster, but that‚Äôs just the start Milan needed after their recent struggles. It‚Äôs a big test for this Spurs side now, and a real examination of their character Conte called for earlier.
GOAL! Milan 1-0 Tottenham (BRAHIM DIAZ 7‚Äô)
20:08 , Jamie Braidwood
The hosts are in front after just seven minutes! It comes from a long ball towards Theo Hernandez on the left. The Milan captain beats Romero to the high ball and from there, breaks into the box. Hernandez drives a shot straight at Forster, who palms into danger. Diaz follows it up and although Forster claws at his first shot, the forward heads it in from the goalline!
Nightmare start for Spurs.
Milan 0-0 Tottenham
20:08 , Jamie Braidwood
6 mins: Leao chops inside Kulusevski and is then chopped down by the Tottenham forward.
Milan 0-0 Tottenham
20:07 , Jamie Braidwood
5 mins: Kulusevski turns down the chance to swing the ball into the box as Spurs waste a short corner, but it‚Äôs been a decent start from the Premier League side.
Milan 0-0 Tottenham
20:05 , Jamie Braidwood
3 mins: The free-kick finds Leao on the other side of the box but his header is cleared by Lenglet. Son tries to break but he is taken down.
Tottenham then work it wide to Kulusevski, but Thiaw wins his challenge on the touchline.
Milan 0-0 Tottenham
20:03 , Jamie Braidwood
1 min: Tottenham, all in white, are booed every time they touch the ball early on. There are early touches for Skipp and Sarr, but Tottenham give it away and Emerson lunges in to bring down Leao from behind.
KICK OFF! Milan 0-0 Tottenham
20:01 , Jamie Braidwood
Underway in Milan!
Milan vs Tottenham
20:00 , Jamie Braidwood
What a noise inside the San Siro! Over 80,000 fans have flocked to see Milan‚Äôs first Champions League knockout game in 10 years.
The stadium will fall silent for a moment of silence for the victims of the earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
Milan vs Tottenham
19:57 , Jamie Braidwood
Here we go! The players are in the tunnel, almost time for that anthem... The Champions League is back!
‚ÄòNon Ti Ho Tradito‚Äô is the banner in the San Siro from the Milan fans.
It‚Äôs a Valentines Day theme... ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not cheating on you‚Äù
Milan vs Tottenham
19:48 , Jamie Braidwood
Antonio Conte, speaking to BT Sport:
On Tottenham injuries: ‚ÄúLast week we had important injuries and big losses for us, but this is the reality and we have to face the situation, to show character and the right spirit. In this situation, it‚Äôs no use to complain or cry, you have to become stronger and face the situation in the best possible way.‚Äù
On Skipp and Sarr starting in midfield: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a big night for both. We are talking about young players but really good prospects. We trust them a lot and they feel our trust. Our expectation is a good performance and to adapt to the emotion.‚Äù
On Milan‚Äôs formation: ‚ÄúThey started to play with a three but it‚Äôs the same system as us, 3-4-3. I‚Äôm not surprised.‚Äù
Milan vs Tottenham
19:41 , Jamie Braidwood
Tottenham legend Glenn Hoddle says Antonio Conte‚Äôs tactics cannot work in the Champions League.
He told The Independent: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think [Spurs] can go out and control a game, certainly with that system.
‚ÄúWe have to pedal back because he wants to go to a five. It is very hard to get pressure on the ball in midfield then. You can press high up, but if they get through then you‚Äôre in trouble.
‚ÄúThey have to play that way, but I‚Äôm not sure they can go and play that way against a Real Madrid. If they get past Milan they‚Äôd need a good draw again to get to the semis.
The last time Milan hosted Tottenham
19:36 , Jamie Braidwood
It‚Äôs 12 years to the day since Tottenham last played AC Milan in the San Siro, in what was one of the club‚Äôs greatest nights. Peter Crouch‚Äôs goal earned a 1-0 win for Tottenham, before they knocked the Italian side out in the next leg to reach the quarter-finals.
The match is perhaps best remembered, though, for Gennaro Gattuso‚Äôs headbutt on Joe Jordan after the final whistle.
‚ÄúGattuso lost himself,‚Äù Jordan told Sky in 2016. ‚ÄúIt was a big game, he was captain of his club, we won the game and he had problems with one or two of the players. He had a problem with the referee. He obviously had a problem with himself. He picked on an old man like me.‚Äù
Milan vs Tottenham
19:28 , Jamie Braidwood
‚ÄúThe more concerning point is how the financial gap between England and everyone else means it‚Äôs still so much for opposition to overcome. Chelsea‚Äôs easy group-stage wins over Milan felt so instructive.
‚ÄúSo, while a fixture between Tottenham and the Italian champions feels like it should be huge ‚Äì and that Milan are of course the bigger club ‚Äì it takes a different perspective if you stand back. It is one of Europe‚Äôs wealthiest clubs against a side in the third financial tier. That usually tends to tell, and is often forgiving for the wealthier side.
The great encouragement for Milan beyond their own return to form this weekend, however, is how Leicester eviscerated Spurs on Saturday. Milan, coincidentally, are one place ‚Äì and ‚Ç¨12m (¬£10.6m) ‚Äì ahead of Leicester in the latest Deloitte Football Money League.
‚ÄúThey are seven places and - more importantly ‚Äì 50 per cent of the revenue behind Spurs. If it feels so dreary to be talking about this, that is the world that Uefa and the Premier League have created.‚Äù
The Champions League is back ‚Äì and the Premier League is primed to dominate
The Champions League is back ‚Äì and the Premier League is primed to dominate
19:13 , Jamie Braidwood
As managers such as Stefano Pioli and Marco Rose try to work out how to set up against English clubs for the Champions League‚Äôs returns, executives across the competition‚Äôs clubs are actually thinking in similar terms. Such is boardroom fear of Premier League power that there is now an increasing refrain in meetings: ‚ÄúSomething must be done.‚Äù
It remains to be seen whether that something will be the Super League that was relaunched last week and is intended to supplant the Champions League itself. It is nevertheless a feeling that frames the knockout stages, especially amid the expectation that at least three English clubs will get through from the last 16 for the fourth time in five years.
Something very significant did actually happen in the Premier League itself, of course, that could well influence this future. Manchester City were charged with multiple breaches of the English competition‚Äôs rules, and essentially accused of fraud. That at least changes the atmosphere around another core theme going into these knockout games.
The last-16 fixtures are the first in the Champions League since the World Cup, and it could also be said that also means they represent the first of a new era in football.
Champions League knockout stage preview, by Miguel Delaney
The Champions League is back ‚Äì and the Premier League is primed to dominate
Milan vs Tottenham
19:03 , Jamie Braidwood
Here are Tottenham - they are facing AC Milan for the first time since 2011 tonight, but they played at the San Siro two seasons ago against Inter.
The lads have arrived at the San Siro üôå pic.twitter.com/3X0aGzphwE
‚Äî Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) February 14, 2023
Is Antonio Conte too stubborn to improve his Champions League record?
18:56 , Jamie Braidwood
For a self-proclaimed winner, it is a return to the place he last won. Two seasons in the dugout at San Siro brought Inter Milan‚Äôs first Scudetto for 11 years. It is the sort of achievement that burnished Antonio Conte‚Äôs image of himself. He has five league titles in his last seven full seasons in club football. Jurgen Klopp, Thomas Tuchel and Carlo Ancelotti, to name but three, cannot claim as much.
If they are placed on a higher managerial plane, deemed among the real elite, it is because of the Champions League. Facing AC Milan takes Conte back, and not merely because he is a former Juventus and Inter manager. His last Champions League final was against Milan: 20 years ago, when he was a Juventus substitute and they lost on penalties at Old Trafford. It was also an all-Serie A final, something which feels implausible now, when Milan are outbid by Bournemouth for players, when Conte‚Äôs stuttering Tottenham are arguably favourites in a two-legged tie against the reigning Italian champions.
The gap on Conte‚Äôs CV lies in Europe. Not as a player: during his Juve career, they reached four Champions League finals and he played in three, winning one. But as a manager: he has never reached the last four.
AC Milan vs Tottenham preview by Richard Jolly
Is Antonio Conte too stubborn to improve his Champions League record?
Milan vs Tottenham: Confirmed line-ups!
18:51 , Jamie Braidwood
As expected, Tottenham look very short in midfield with Bentancur and Bissouma injured and Hojbjerg suspended. Antonio Conte has one solution left and goes with Oliver Skipp, 20, and Pape Matar Sarr, 22, as his midfield pair.
Tottenham look strong up front with Kane, Kulusevski and Son all starting, while Clement Lenglet is preferred to Ben Davies at left centre-back.
What a night it is too for goalkeeper Fraser Forster, who stands in for the injured Hugo Lloris. The 34-year-old previously played in the Champions League with Celtic.
Milan vs Tottenham: Confirmed line-ups!
18:44 , Jamie Braidwood
AC Milan: Tatarusanu; Thiaw, Kalulu, Kjaer, Hernandez; Saelemaekers, Krunic, Tonali; Diaz, Giroud, Leao
Tottenham: Forster; Emerson, Romero, Dier, Lenglet, Perisic; Sarr, Skipp; Kulusevski, Kane, Son
Milan vs Tottenham
18:28 , Jamie Braidwood
Antonio Conte says he is still not 100 per cent following gallbladder surgery but added it‚Äôs important to be back with the team in difficult situation
‚ÄúFor sure, it was really difficult to stay far from the team,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄúBecause you have a sense of responsibility that you want to stay every moment with your players, to breathe the environment in every situation.
‚ÄúBut this problem happened and now I‚Äôm feeling much better than before.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not still 100 per cent but I think I‚Äôm recovering well, it‚Äôs very important for me to stay with the team, work with them and try to stay together in a difficult moment for us.‚Äù
Milan vs Tottenham
18:14 , Jamie Braidwood
Antonio Conte effectively confirmed Oliver Skipp and Pape Matar Sarr will start tonight at the San Siro
‚ÄúWe have the solution in our house, with the two young players, Skippy and Pape Sarr.
‚ÄúYou know we are talking about two young players, their first game in the Champions League, they are really young - 20 and 22 years old.
‚ÄúEspecially for this reason we have to be good to help them to overcome the emotion, and then we trust them.‚Äù
Milan vs Tottenham: Conte suggests some Spurs players collapse under pressure
17:58 , Jamie Braidwood
Antonio Conte has suggested some of his Tottenham players are prone to collapsing under pressure ahead of tonight‚Äôs last-16 first-leg tie at AC Milan.
Conte, who says he is still not 100 per cent following gallbladder surgery, watched his side beat champions Manchester City and then follow it up by being thrashed 4-1 at Leicester at the weekend, when a spot in the Premier League top four was theirs for the taking.
Spurs have notoriously failed in big moments over the years and Conte has hinted some of his players cannot live with the pressure.
‚ÄúIf you want to win or achieve some targets and have a good position in the Champions League or in England in the Premier League you have to be stable,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd this stability is lacking this year. I always talk about it with my players. It is very difficult to keep concentration, it is very difficult to stay focused all of the time.

Hello and welcome to The Independent‚Äôs live coverage of Tottenham vs AC Milan in the first leg of the Champions League last-16 at the San Siro tonight.
Antonio Conte‚Äôs side progressed to the knockout stages after a dramatic victory in Marseille, with Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg‚Äôs late goal securing top spot with the last kick of the game. Spurs come into the test against the Italian champions reeling, however, following a 4-1 thrashing at Leicester on Sunday, as well as a number of injury absences.
Tottenham have been rocked by the news that Rodrigo Bentancur has been ruled out for the season and with Hojbjerg and Yves Bissouma also injured, Conte is set to field an inexperienced midfield duo tonight. Harry Kane will hope to lead Tottenham towards the quarter-finals, however, as they face a Milan side who have also been struggling for form.
The Serie A champions have lost four of their last five matches in all competitions under Stefano Pioli, including heavy defeats to Inter, Lazio and Sassuolo. Milan, who are seven-time European champions, are looking to reach their first Champions League quarter-final since 2012.
